sentences.english: Since childhood love of art, hard-working people, self-taught.
sentences.chinese: 自幼熱愛美術，勤奮過人，自學成材。

sentences.english: Later, Gongxing Lun at the beginning of a long self-study and examination, a full 7 years.
sentences.chinese: 後來，龔興倫開頭了漫長的自學和考試，整整7年。

sentences.english: Go on learning the text in groups , and translate.
sentences.chinese: 小組內自學課文，熟讀並翻譯。

sentences.english: Hitler's just a self-educated street agitator.
sentences.chinese: 希特勒無非是個自學出身的街頭煽動家罷了。

sentences.english: This demand necessity of complement, but self-educated is a kind of the best path.
sentences.chinese: 這就需要必要的補充，而自學是一種最佳的途徑。

sentences.english: Child as he is, he has taught himself advanced mathematics.
sentences.chinese: 儘管他是個孩子，但他已自學完了高等數學。

sentences.english: She was homeschooled by her mom.
sentences.chinese: 她由媽媽輔導在家自學。

sentences.english: I learn English all by myself.
sentences.chinese: 我的英語是自學成才的。

sentences.english: In brief, self-study is all about us basically.
sentences.chinese: 總之，自學基本上都是關於我們自己的。

sentences.english: There are many examples of people who achieve success by self-study.
sentences.chinese: 在這方面，有很多依靠自學取得成功的例子。

sentences.english: Many young musicians in Iraq are self-taught.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克很多年輕音樂家都是自學成才的。

sentences.english: It is also suitable for English learners with various level.
sentences.chinese: 也適用於水平不一的英語自學者。

sentences.english: She now homeschools our kids, and is trying to give them the freedom to learn on their own.
sentences.chinese: 現在她在家教育我們的孩子，讓他們有自學的自由。

sentences.english: The Self-Study Examination Instruction Group of the National Higher Education Committee recently made a decision in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 自學考試指導委員會日前在北京作出決定。

sentences.english: Self-study ability implies that you can read the teaching materials positively by yourself.
sentences.chinese: 自學能力意味着你能自己主動地閱讀教材。

sentences.english: He had an excellent command of Latin and Greek through self-learning.
sentences.chinese: 通過自學，他已經很好地掌握了拉丁語和希臘語。

definition: to teach/teaching and learning/education/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]
entrance door/to enter a door/introduction (to a subject)
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
specialty/specialized field/main field of study (at university)/major/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]/professional
to read a book/to study/to attend school
